title: Wireless Power Supply-Aware Non-Orthogonal Multiple Access IoT Network Design and Optimization

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Communication Theory, Linear Algebra, Probability Theory, and Foundations of Machine Learning
context.additional_context: Focuses on learners with mid-level expertise in medical/legal/technical fields mastering IoT network design principles and applying deep learning-based optimization techniques

learning_goals: Learners can explain the principles of wireless power supply and spectrum efficiency optimization in NOMA-based IoT networks.
Learners can implement a system for predicting Block Error Rate (BLER) and throughput (goodput) using deep learning models.
Learners can design a power allocation optimization algorithm applying SIC (Successive Interference Cancellation) techniques in a limited CSI environment.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
